byline: Scott Tong, Stan Alcorn, Nancy Marshall-Genzer, David Brancaccio and Kitty Wells
description: Airing Monday, February 9, 2015: A senate report set to be released today says that cars connected to the internet could be a security risk. More on that. Plus, there's news the average price of gasoline is up 13 cents in the last two weeks. Some are saying the crash for gas prices is coming to an end. We look at the International Energy Agency's look-ahead for the next five years, set to be released tomorrow. And there was a time not so long ago that American bankers avoided mentioning their occupation. In the U.S., some of that stigma has evaporated. But in the UK, there's a plan to prosecute senior bankers if things go wrong.
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, February 9, 2015
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, February 9, 2015

Plus, there's news the average price of gasoline is up 13 cents in the last two weeks. Some are saying the crash for gas prices is coming to an end. We look at the International Energy Agency's look-ahead for the next five years, set to be released tomorrow. And there was a time not so long ago that American bankers avoided mentioning their occupation. In the U.S., some of that stigma has evaporated. But in the UK, there's a plan to prosecute senior bankers if things go wrong.
